comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: That's "Henni" not "Henri" Forchhammer, pictured here: see also: An online Danish biographical encyclopedia provides information on most of the people in this photo. It identifies Carl Frederik Simony Thalbitzer (1876-1970) as a Danish economist and journalist who participated in the neutral peace conference in Stockholm in 1916. www.denstoredanske.dk/Dansk_Biografisk_Leksikon/Samfund,_... Olaf Forchhammer (1881-1964), Henni's brother, was an engineer involved in many pacifist activities and causes. www.denstoredanske.dk/Dansk_Biografisk_Leksikon/Naturvide... A.F. Lamm (Aron Frederik Lamm) (1856-1928) was a stockbroker and politician active in social causes. The biographical entry does not specifically link him to the Stockholm Mediation Conference. www.denstoredanske.dk/Dansk_Biografisk_Leksikon/Samfund,_... The man on the right is identified as Asfred Bajer. I can't find much information on him, but an ancestry site identifies him as the eldest son of the Danish pacifist and politician Fredrik Bajer, winner of the Nobel Peace Prize in 1908. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fredrik_Bajer www.mytrees.com/newanc/Other/Died-1871/Ba/Bajer-family/As... Likewise, there is no M. Klausen in the encyclopedia, but there is K.M. Klausen , Kristoffer Marqvard Klausen ,(1852-1924), a politician involved in many social causes similar to the aim of the Mediation Conference. www.denstoredanske.dk/Dansk_Biografisk_Leksikon/Samfund,_... An article on the Neutral Conference for Continuous Mediation lists Kristoffer Marqvard Klausen as a Danish delegate to the Central Committee. archive.org/stream/jstor-20667582/20667582#page/n1/mode/2up
